lines.text:
[to Maureen]
Stupid bitch! You could have been comin' instead of goin'!

[to Maureen]
Wasn't your own sin red enough? You'll burn in hell for this! You'll burn in hell!
Put me closer to the window.
Someone will see you, Mother.
Are you ashamed of me?
You know why, Mother. They've even written about you in the newspapers.
Stop your whining, boy. All this fuss over nothing.
Not nothing. I-I saw her. Even the initials on her suitcase, "M.C." Marion Crane.
Another of your cheap erotic delusions, out of your cheap erotic imagination. You killed her. The slut deserved it. But she's dead and the dead don't come back.
Y-Y-You came back.

I never went away don't you know that by now? You can't get rid of me. I'll always be with you Norman. Always. Stand up straight and wipe your snotty little nose. If the disgusting little whore is going to upset you so much, just get rid of her.
No!
Then maybe I will.

[to Norma Bates]
You! You made me do this, your tainted blood in me!
[a cartoon laughs from the TV]
Don't laugh at me, Mother! Don't laugh at me!

[to Norman]
She was crazy Norman, but she wasn't your mother... Neither are you!
It's lies. It's all lies. Norman, she's a lying whore!
Norman! Norman where are you?
She's a slut!
Norman!
Don't let her talk about me like that!
Norman! Please, Norman, please listen to me! Norman, Mrs. Bates, whoever you are, damn it doesn't it make any difference in that demented brain of yours?
Kill her, boy. Get her! Just like the others! Get her!
Oh! No! Don't! No! Please! Norman, no!

[Norman stabs mother]
Norman! Can't you do anything right? How dare you treat your mother in such... a... way... Norman.
So I don't have the guts, huh?
Emma Spool just doesn't show up for work one day. I just hope nothing serious happened to the old girl.
You mean like Norman Bates?
What about him? Are you another relative of somebody he killed?
Conservative clothes never go out of style.

[to Norma Bates]
Mother!

[to Norma Bates]
Mother! Oh God Mother! Blood, blood!
You dirty, dirty boy
But I... I didn't do anything, Mother... I didn't do anything, Mother. She's a nice girl.
She's a whore.
But we didn't do anything.
You let her come between us.
But this... It isn't right. It isn't natural.
It's perfectly natural for a son to love his mother.
God, will you leave me alone, Mother? Will you leave me alone?
Doesn't scan does it Norman? But... a lot of shit around here doesn't.
What are you doing with my mother?
Don't you mean mummy? You did a nice job on her Norman. Fresh as the day she croaked.

[to Norman]
Norman! What the hell's the matter with you?
Get that whore out of my house! Throw her down in the muck and filth where she belongs!
I'll get you for this, Mother. I'll get you for this.
You haven't got the guts, boy.
You must think I've gone mad.
Oh, no... no. We all go a little mad sometimes.
Mmm... Oh, God, don't tell me you're one of those guys who farts, rolls over, and then goes to sleep!
I picked you up in a bar, after one lousy drink! Whaddya wanna to get married?
You shit-heel!
[She slaps him]
Look! I gotta get up for work soon, so why don't you just go home, huh?
How? You brought me out here.
Here's cab fare. Phone book's on the table.
Jesus, You make it all sound so cheap.
It is? But it beats a good vibrator.
Yeah? Well at least a vibrator gets me off!
[Flips him off]

[Grabs Red]
Use the payphone, bitch!

[to Tracy]
I've had enough of this Nancy Drew horse-shit from you.

[Repeated Line]
Watch the guitar.

[to Duke]
She can't help it. She can't help the things she does. She's just an old lady. A sick old lady.

[to Tracy]
Why can't you leave my poor son, my poor Norman alone?
[last lines]
I was for you then. Believed in you. You made a fool of me. Look, what you did to yourself. Why, Norman, why? Good God son. You'll never get out again. We're gonna have you locked up forever.
But I'll be free. I'll finally be free.
Please Maureen, you mustn't. You have an obligation to him.
I haven't. I have nothing.
You can't.

[to Tracy]
The guy just wants to be left alone in peace.
Norman, is that you?
Yes, Mother, it's me.

[to Sheriff Hunt]
Aren't you going to take him in for questioning or anything?

[to Maureen]
Aside from total boredom, nothing's gonna happen to you here.

[to Tracy]
Just leave him alone.
I can't have that sort of thing going on in my motel. It gives the place a bad name.

[answering the phone]
Bates Motel.
Why are you so kind to me?
You remind me of someone.

[to Tracy]
I figured Bates was a geek, but a full fledged Looney Tune.
Want a ride or are you carrying the Olympic torch in that suitcase?
Thank you.
Can anyone tell me if there's a very inexpensive place to spend the night around here?

[to Tracy]
What Norman did was a very long time ago and he payed the price. Anyway he's okay now.

[Reaches in to the ice machine and pulls out a handful of ice without noticing that the ice is covered in blood]
Don't tell me my job Ms. Venable!

[Puts bloody ice into his mouth and sucks on it]
'Despite all your glib insinuations, I don't have one iota of proof that he's done anything!"

[picks up Maureen on the highway]
Goin' to L.A. to be a rock and roll star. What about you? Where you goin'? What were you doin' back there?
I, uh...
Car trouble?
Yes, yes. I had car trouble.
Oh yeah? What kind?
Uh... no car.
No car?
[laughs]
Well, that's the worst kind.
Room?
Uh, I'd love one. I don't think I can afford it, though. You know, you ought to keep that register closed. Somebody will steal you blind.
Wouldn't get very far on what's in there, I'm afraid.
Business slow?
Well, you're my first customer of the day. Or did you just stop in for directions to the Interstate? Well, it's the next...
No, actually, I was interested in that "Help Wanted" sign in the window. But if business is bad, I
Oh - Oh - Oh - Oh - it's not bad. This is just a - just a slump.
[Duke looks at room keys]

Oh, yeah, yeah, well, 12 cabins, 12 vacancies. Well, we've been closed for a while. Renovations. But there's more life along this road than there used to be. And good prices. Good service. Things will pick up. I've got a rebuilt ice machine and four cabins booked for later in the week. Fairvale High's homecoming. Big game against Central.
[pauses]
I seem to be rattling on. Yes, there is a job. Are you interested?
In money? The only honest way I know to get it is earn it or inherit it.
[laughs]
And I don't have any rich relatives about to die. Got an application form?
Oh, that won't be necessary. My name's Norman. Norman Bates.
[offers his hand, covered in blood]
Whoa. What you been painting?
Oh, I'm sorry. I - Step into the back, the parlor, while I clean up.
Said the spider to the fly.
Hmm?
[sees the stuffed birds]
Local branch of the Audobon Society?
My hobby. Stuffing things.
[first lines]
There is no God!
